column4: Hi.. Can i get some help? Last night i installed ubuntu from the official cd. I got alot of Trying to fix it, but a reboot is needed. A friend of me told me to run memtest86 to see if there was some problems with my ram. If i'm gonna run memtest86 from the livecd. what do i type on the boot: line?
if you installed, grub should give you a memtest boot option
hmm.. so i don't need a livecd?
well, _i_ have a memtest boot option
hoary, right?
not sure how you would run memtest through live anyways
correct
hmm this is odd. how do i operate memtest then?
you chose the boot option in grub?
what does the config look like in menu.lst?
i have this:  title          Ubuntu, kernel memtest86+ <newline> root           (hd0,2) <newline> kernel         /boot/memtest86+.bin <newline> boot
you might need to change the (hd0,2) line
how?
i thought you get nothing when you ran it?
when i installed source i got Trying to fix it, but a reboot is needed
er, and a reboot doesn't fix it?
er, what programs?
if i'm gonna reinstall all packages again, how do i do that?
if lots of programs are crashing on you... i don't see how reinstalling would fix things..like your friend said, try and do a memtest
I am trying to do so, but you seem to ignore me. I need help on how to do so.
not ignoring....just a little confused...sorry.   ok, so running memtest gives you a blank screen?
googling...i'm not sure if that's an error, or if so...what it means
